column4: UPDATE 2-U.S. junk bond funds post 4th-biggest week of outflows ever -Lipper
column5: (Adds details on mutual funds and ETFs  table)     By Trevor Hunnicutt     NEW YORK  Nov 16 U.S. fund investors walloped high-yield funds with their biggest week of withdrawals since March  Lipper data showed on Thursday.     The junk bond mutual funds and exchange-traded funds (ETFs) posted $4.4 billion in net withdrawals during the week ended Nov. 15  the fourth-largest weekly outflow on record dating back to 1992.     Several concerns weighed on high-yield markets during the week

column4: Breakfast at Tiffany's: At long last  Fifth Avenue store opens a cafe
column5: NEW YORK A half-century after Audrey Hepburn starred in "Breakfast at Tiffany's " the landmark New York jewelry store is making the title of the 1961 romantic comedy film a reality by opening a cafe where shoppers can enjoy a morning meal. | Video

column4: U.S. junk bond funds post fourth-biggest week of outflows ever: Lipper
column5: NEW YORK U.S. fund investors walloped high-yield funds with their biggest week of withdrawals since March  Lipper data showed on Thursday.

column4: UPDATE 2-U.S. junk bond funds post 4th-biggest week of outflows ever -Lipper
column5: (Adds details on mutual funds and ETFs  table)     By Trevor Hunnicutt     NEW YORK  Nov 16 U.S. fund investors walloped high-yield funds with their biggest week of withdrawals since March  Lipper data showed on Thursday.     The junk bond mutual funds and exchange-traded funds (ETFs) posted $4.4 billion in net withdrawals during the week ended Nov. 15  the fourth-largest weekly outflow on record dating back to 1992.     Several concerns weighed on high-yield markets during the week

column4: Fitch Assigns 'BBB-' Rating to Torchmark's Junior Subordinated Debentures
column5: (The following statement was released by the rating agency) CHICAGO  November 17 (Fitch) Fitch Ratings has assigned a 'BBB-' rating to Torchmark Corporation's (TMK) issuance of $125 million of junior subordinated debentures due 2057. The rating being assigned to the new debt is equivalent to the ratings assigned to TMK's existing junior subordinated debentures and reflects standard notching for a hybrid with its risk characteristics. Based on Fitch's rating criteria  the securities are notched u

column4: Electric cars not ready for mass production yet: Toyota chairman to Spiegel
column5: FRANKFURT Battery-powered cars are not ready for mass production yet  the chairman of Japan's Toyota Motor Corp told a German magazine  adding that he did not see U.S. electric vehicle pioneer Tesla as a role model.

column4: Toyota and Suzuki in tie-up to sell electric vehicles in India
column5: TOKYO Toyota Motor Corp and Suzuki Motor Corp have agreed to cooperate in selling electric vehicles in India from around 2020  they said on Friday  aiming to give each other a leg up in emerging markets and low-emission technology.

column4: Toyota to consider selling locally developed EVs in China
column5: GUANGZHOU/BEIJING Toyota Motor  said it would consider selling locally designed and manufactured all-electric vehicle models in China  as it looks to expand its EV lineup and comply with Beijing's upcoming new-energy vehicle (NEV) production and sales quotas.

column4: AUTOSHOW-Toyota to consider selling locally developed EVs in China
column5: * Toyota to start selling in China in 2020 an EV designed in Japan

column4: AUTOSHOW-Toyota to consider selling locally-developed EVs in China
column5: GUANGZHOU/BEIJING  Nov 17 Toyota Motor Corp will consider selling in China all-electric battery car models developed by its two local joint ventures  the automaker said on Friday in a press release.

column4: No date set yet for Keystone pipeline restart: TransCanada spokesman
column5: CALGARY  Alberta No date has been set yet for a restart of TransCanada Corp's Keystone pipeline  which was shut down on Thursday after a 5 000-barrel crude oil leak in South Dakota  a company spokesman said on Friday.

column4: UPDATE 3-Keystone pipeline spill pushes oil higher  fuels TransCanada opponents
column5: CALGARY  Alberta/LINCOLN  Neb.  Nov 17 A major oil spill on the Keystone pipeline in South Dakota helped push U.S. crude prices higher on Friday  while fueling opposition to another pipeline project by owner TransCanada Corp that faces a crunch decision in Nebraska next week.

column4: No date set yet for Keystone pipeline restart - TransCanada spokesman
column5: CALGARY  Alberta  Nov 17 No date has been set yet for a restart of TransCanada Corp's Keystone pipeline  which was shut down on Thursday after a 5 000-barrel crude oil leak in South Dakota  a company spokesman said on Friday.

column4: UPDATE 1-South Dakota pipeline spill hits TransCanada shares  Canada crude price
column5: CALGARY  Alberta/LINCOLN  Nebraska Nov 17 (Reuters) - C anadian heavy crude prices and TransCanada Corp shares slid on Friday  the day after the Keystone pipeline spilled 5 000 barrels of oil in South Dakota as officials in Nebraska mulled whether to approve another pipeline proposed by the company.

column4: Keystone oil pipeline leaks in South Dakota  as Nebraska weighs XL
column5: CALGARY  Alberta TransCanada Corp  shut part of its Keystone oil pipeline system after a 5 000-barrel leak in South Dakota  the company said on Thursday  four days before neighboring Nebraska was set to decide on the company's long-delayed Keystone XL pipeline.

column4: Discount on Canadian heavy crude deepens after pipeline spill
column5: CALGARY  Alberta  Nov 17 The discount on Canadian heavy crude surged wider on Friday as traders waited for news on how long TransCanada Corp's 590 000 barrel per day Keystone pipeline would be shut down following a spill in South Dakota on Thursday.
